statement:
Let $C$ be a projective nonsingular curve over an algebraically closed
field. If $D$ is a divisor on $C$, then

$$\ell(D) - \ell(K-D) = {\rm deg}(D) + 1 - g$$

where $g$ is the genus of the curve, and $K$ is the canonical divisor
($\ell(K)=g$). Here $\ell(D)$ denotes the dimension of the .
